title: Numbering Systems Quiz
description: Quiz covering number systems and conversions.

questions.text: What is the binary equivalent of the decimal number 75?
questions.explanation: 75 in decimal is equal to 01001011 in binary.

questions.text: What is the hexadecimal equivalent of the binary number 11110000?
questions.explanation: 11110000 in binary is equal to F0 in hexadecimal.

questions.text: The octal number system is base 16.
questions.explanation: The octal number system is base 8.

questions.text: What is the decimal equivalent of the hexadecimal number 2A?
questions.explanation: 2A in hexadecimal is equal to 2*16 + 10 = 42 in decimal.

questions.text: What is the binary equivalent of the hexadecimal number A5?
questions.explanation: A5 in hexadecimal is equal to 10100101 in binary.

questions.text: The binary number 1010 is equal to the decimal number 12.
questions.explanation: The binary number 1010 is equal to the decimal number 10.

questions.text: What is the octal equivalent of the decimal number 63?
questions.explanation: 63 in decimal is equal to 77 in octal.

questions.text: What is the hexadecimal equivalent of the decimal number 160?
questions.explanation: 160 in decimal is equal to A0 in hexadecimal.

questions.text: What is the binary equivalent of the octal number 37?
questions.explanation: 37 in octal is equal to 011111 in binary.

questions.text: The hexadecimal number 10 is equal to the decimal number 10.
questions.explanation: The hexadecimal number 10 is equal to the decimal number 16.

questions.text: What is the decimal equivalent of the octal number 45?
questions.explanation: 45 in octal is equal to 4*8 + 5 = 37 in decimal.

questions.text: What is the hexadecimal equivalent of the decimal number 42?
questions.explanation: 42 in decimal is equal to 2A in hexadecimal.

questions.text: The binary number 1111 is equal to the decimal number 16.
questions.explanation: The binary number 1111 is equal to the decimal number 15.

questions.text: What is the octal equivalent of the decimal number 15?
questions.explanation: 15 in decimal is equal to 17 in octal.

questions.text: What is the binary equivalent of the decimal number 100?
questions.explanation: 100 in decimal is equal to 01100100 in binary.

questions.text: The hexadecimal number FF is equal to the decimal number 256.
questions.explanation: The hexadecimal number FF is equal to the decimal number 255.

questions.text: What is the decimal equivalent of the binary number 11001100?
questions.explanation: 11001100 in binary is equal to 204 in decimal.

questions.text: What is the hexadecimal equivalent of the decimal number 31?
questions.explanation: 31 in decimal is equal to 1F in hexadecimal.

questions.text: The octal number 10 is equal to the decimal number 10.
questions.explanation: The octal number 10 is equal to the decimal number 8.

questions.text: What is the binary equivalent of the octal number 77?
questions.explanation: 77 in octal is equal to 111111 in binary.
